name: NPR
text:
In newly released footage, former officer Tou Thao seems increasingly agitated as the crowd gets more vocal, with onlookers repeatedly asking why George Floyd's vitals weren't being checked.

At one point, Thao says, "This is why you don't do drugs, kids." https://t.co/RZmUeyihIs

name: NPR
text:
Cheryl Barnes, who has diabetes, tells @IowaPublicRadio she has nothing left to eat but bread after Monday's deadly derecho storm.

“I know my blood sugar has been high, so I have to be extremely careful.” https://t.co/1wQd6nDfyM

name: NPR
text:
As part of the deal to normalize relations with the UAE, Israel has agreed to suspend its controversial plans to annex territory in the occupied West Bank — territory Palestinians have long hoped to be a part of a future state.
https://t.co/VND7hsHhoD

name: NPR
text:
Political leaders, community advocates and activists are cheering Kamala Harris' addition to the Democratic ticket as a powerful elevation of a woman of color — one that could change the perception of who is seen as a leader in the U.S.
https://t.co/xCHulsotEs

name: NPR
text:
President Trump has ordered TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to sell its U.S. assets in 90 days, stating American authorities have "credible evidence" the Chinese tech giant could take action to imperil national security.
https://t.co/7C3YhAfG9Y

name: NPR
text:
A study from Duke University appears to conclude that wearing a neck gaiter is worse than no mask at all. 

But researchers say don’t get rid of your gaiter just yet. https://t.co/6lbxFssWza
